abstract.text: Analyze how often people open your App Store apps, and the average session duration.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Use these reports to understand how often people open your app, and how long they spend in your app.
Platforms: iOS, iPadOS, macOS, tvOS, visionOS
Weekly: Every Friday for the previous week (Monday to Sunday).
Monthly: On the fifth day of the following month.
Completeness: Within five days. Weekly and monthly reports are complete by default.
History: On request, data is available beginning on January 1, 2024.
Includes data from users who have opted to share their data with Apple and developers. Data is provided only when events exist from at least five users for the respective report.
Data is available in two reports: standard and detailed.
reports include fields not easily related to uniquely identifiable user data.

reports include all fields and also include additional privacy measures for the data, to help protect uniquely identifiable information for individuals. Download the standard report unless you need to analyze the unique fields in the detailed report. To learn more, see

The Analytics Reports framework delivers new portions of report content as instances. Each instance can contain one or more batches of data, to accommodate late-arriving events, or in rare cases, data corrections.  To learn more, see
Date on which the event occurred. For weekly and monthly instances, this column represents the first day of the week and month, respectively.
The name of the app provided  by you during app setup in App Store Connect.
The version of the app being associated with the session.
Type of device on which the event occurred
The OS version on the device associated with the session.
Where the user discovered the app associated with the session.
The app referrer or web referrer that led the user to discover the app.
The Campaign Token of the campaign created in  App Analytics. Column available starting November 19, 2024.
The product page type which led the user to download the app associated with the session.
The name of the product page or in-app event page that led the user to download the app associated with the session.
The date on which the app was downloaded onto the device. This field is only populated if the download occurred in the previous 30 days, otherwise it is null.
The App Store country or region in which the session occurred.
The number of sessions. Based on users who have agreed to share their data with Apple and developers.
The total duration, in seconds, of all sessions being reported.
The number of unique devices contributing to the total number of sessions being reported.
Your app was viewed in the search tab on the App Store. Includes Search Ads and suggestions in App Store search.
Your app was viewed while the user was browsing the App Store. Includes all App Store tabs excluding the Search tab.
A link to your app’s product page was presented to the user in another app.
A link to your app’s product page was presented to the user on a website.
Your app was presented to the user in an App Clip.
Your app was presented to the user in an App Store generated notification.
The source type is unavailable. Includes apps downloaded using App Store gift cards, promotional codes, or Mobile Device Management software.
The user downloaded your app from your app’s product page.
The user downloaded your app from an in-app event page.
The user downloaded the app from a store sheet in the App Store.
Your app was presented in a list view to the user and there was no page title associated with the download.
Your app was presented to the user in an App Store generated notification.

abstract.text: Analyze how users engage with your App Clips.
Review crashes for your App Store apps based on app version and device type.
Analyze details on the number of times users install and delete your apps.
Review how people use CarPlay in your app.
Understand how the Analytics Reports API provides complete data sets.
Understand measures that help protect user privacy.

doc://com.apple.devpubs.analytics-report.title: Protecting user privacy in report data

abstract.text: A list of app development reports, their field descriptions, and glossaries.
